node.title: '70s-style prom night, uni ball spark Christmas COVID chaos in Newcastle
node.alt: A sign reading Argyle House on a nightclub building.
node.description: Thousands are in isolation and authorities are racing to track the potential spread of Omicron in the city after scores of people who went to a nightclub event tested positive for coronavirus. The attendees of a university ball have also been deemed close contacts.
node.content:
["A night where revellers were urged to wear vintage formal wear at a Newcastle club has resulted in\u00a0COVID chaos.", "About 700 people checked in to The Argyle House on Wednesday, December 8 for the prom-themed night.", "Now 84 of them have contracted COVID-19, and thousands more are getting tested today.", "The Argyle House patrons partied into the early hours of Thursday morning.", "By Sunday they were deemed close contacts\u00a0after health officials confirmed at least four infectious people linked to a Sydney boat cruise visited the nightclub.", "One of the party boat people had a confirmed case of the Omicron variant.", "The\u00a0exact number of Omicron cases is not known, but\u00a0there is one confirmed case in the city \u2014 a returned traveller from the UK.", "The local health district said the woman and her close contacts had been isolating at home.", "", "
The venue's prom night event was attended by people confirmed to have COVID-19.(Supplied)
", "The significance of the Argyle House cluster is not lost on health officials who have warned that it was \"likely\" a number of patrons have the Omicron strain.", "On top of the nightclub cluster, anyone who attended the University of Newcastle's Fifth Year Medical Ball on the evening of Friday, December 10, has been deemed a close contact.", "They must get tested and isolate for seven days.", "Anyone in their household must get tested and isolate until all residents receive a negative result.", "", "
Anyone who was at The Argyle House on December 8 to December 9 is now considered a close contact.(Supplied)
", "
Other Newcastle venues on alert
", "The Argyle case explosion has other\u00a0licensed venues in the city on high alert.", "More than half a dozen closed today for precautionary cleaning\u00a0after hundreds of patrons linked to their venues were also linked to the cluster.", "Australian Hotels Association Newcastle and Hunter president Mick Starkey said it was a nervous time.", "\"Currently all of the affected hotels are just simply following the health advice in regards to management of the potential outbreak,\" he said.", "", "
Stephen Smyth says plenty of businesses in Newcastle should be concerned about the Argyle cluster.(ABC Newcastle: Bindi Bryce)
", "The Queens Wharf Brewery is one of several bars in Newcastle\u00a0affected by the outbreak at the Argyle.", "One of its workers caught the virus after attending the prom night event with some colleagues.", "\"He has come up positive, but fortunately he hasn't worked here since,\" licensee Stephen Smyth said.", "\"We decided to close, just to protect the public and our other staff, so they're getting tested.\"", "Mr Smyth said it was likely\u00a0Argyle patrons went to other venues and that local businesses should take a cautious approach.", "\"I'd certainly do the self-testing, which we've done here,\" he said.", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
